intro: Perityle aurea, commonly known as the golden perityle, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has small, narrow leaves that are arranged in a basal rosette. Perityle aurea is known for its compact size and is often found in open meadows and along streambanks. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystem.
